title: Clash? Hello?
body: Alright, I'm in my Clash Finals, i'm feeling good. You know what happens? From 1 to 8 minutes or so, ping spikes up to 40k ms. Now, I thought that maybe my router broke, but no. Everyone on team says they're lagging, and discord is going on just fine. The first 8 minutes of the match were unplayable for not only my team, but also the enemy team. Is this really gonna count as a loss for me because I couldn't do anything? Really Riot?

replies.body: This is part of the beta / test experience. I imagine all the data is being run to understand what caused lag spikes / issues and are being fixed. Unfortunately problems like that really only reveal themselves with lots and lots of players playing :X. Hope it wasn't too bad though!
Everyone having 40k ping is pretty bad if you ask me.

Honestly man, Clash isn’t that important. You get a cosmetic banner on your profile and a chance at a more decent skin shard for placing higher.

And it does work, I played Clash last night, all three matches were smooth sailing as far as performance goes. Couldn't have run better, honestly.

It's not going to work *all the time*, especially if it's beta, but if it doesn't work for you doesn't mean it works for nobody. That's how testing works.

Still don't condone losing RGMs for this though.

To be fair, the announcement for this weekends Clash **testing** was to test and see if their feature could be handled after they had refactored they're approach. So stuff like this was to be expected.
